00039 char nToChar(int n, bool upperCase) {
00040     if (n < 10) return char(n+'0');
00041     else if (upperCase) return char((n - 10) + 'A');
00042     else return char((n - 10) + 'a');
00043 }
00044 
00045 } // namespace
00046 
00064 std::string to_string(const integer& n, size_t base, bool uppercase) {
00065     if (base<2 || base>36) throw exceptions::invalid_base();
00066 
00067     if (n.sign()==0) return "0";
00068 
00069     std::ostringstream out;
00070     if (base==16) {
00071         // Special no-division version, primarily for debugging division
00072         //const data_t *ndata=n._get_data();
00073         const digit_t *firstDigit=n._get_digits(),
00074             *lastDigit=firstDigit + n._get_length() - 1;
00075 
00076         const int bitsPerDigit=4;
00077         const digit_t mask=(doubledigit_t(1) << bitsPerDigit)-1;
00078 
00079         // Suppress any leading zeros
00080         const digit_t *d=lastDigit;
00081         int digitShift=(bits_per_digit - bitsPerDigit);
00082         while (digitShift >= 0 && ((*d >> digitShift) & mask) == 0)
00083             digitShift -= bitsPerDigit;
00084 
00085         do {
00086             while (digitShift >= 0) {
00087                 out << nToChar((*d >> digitShift) & mask, uppercase);
00088                 digitShift -= bitsPerDigit;
00089             }
00090 
00091             digitShift=(bits_per_digit - bitsPerDigit);
00092         } while (d-- != firstDigit);
00093 
00094         std::string r(n.sign() < 0 ? std::string("-")+out.str() : out.str());
00095         return r;
00096     } else {
00097         const integer shift=base;
00098         std::pair<integer, integer> a=std::make_pair(n, integer::zero());
00099         a.first._set_negative(false);
00100 
00101         integer r;
00102         while (a.first.sign()!=0) {
00103             a=divide_r(a.first, shift);
00104             out << nToChar(a.second._get_digit(0), uppercase);
00105         }
00106 
00107         if (n.sign() < 0) out << '-';
00108 
00109         std::string rval=out.str();
00110         std::reverse(rval.begin(), rval.end());
00111         return rval;
00112     }
00113 }

00140 integer from_string(const std::string& str, size_t base) {
00141     bool negate=false;
00142     const char *c=str.c_str();
00143     if (*c=='+') ++c;
00144     else if (*c=='-') { negate=true; ++c; }
00145 
00146     if (base==autobase) {
00147         if (*c=='0') {
00148             ++c;
00149             if (*c=='x' || *c=='X') {
00150                 ++c;
00151                 base=16;
00152             } else base=8;
00153         } else base=10;
00154     }
00155 
00156     if (base<2 || base>36) throw exceptions::invalid_base();
00157     if (*c==0) throw exceptions::invalid_digit("No valid digits");
00158 
00159     const integer shift(base);
00160 
00161     integer r;
00162     while (*c) {
00163         unsigned int digit;
00164         if (*c>='0' && *c<='9') digit=*c-'0';
00165         else if (*c>='A' && *c<='Z') digit=*c-'A'+10;
00166         else if (*c>='a' && *c<='z') digit=*c-'a'+10;
00167         else throw exceptions::invalid_digit("encountered non-alphanumeric "
00168             "character in string");
00169 
00170         if (digit >= base) throw exceptions::invalid_digit("encountered digit "
00171             "greater than base allows");
00172 
00173         r = (r * shift) + digit;
00174         ++c;
00175     }
00176     r._set_negative(negate);
00177     return r;
00178 }

00189 integer from_binary(const std::string& str) {
00190     const size_t bytesPerDigit=sizeof(digit_t);
00191     const size_t bitsPerByte=std::numeric_limits<unsigned char>::digits;
00192 
00193     integer r;
00194     r._realloc((str.length() + bytesPerDigit - 1)/bytesPerDigit);
00195     digit_t *p=r._get_digits();
00196 
00197     unsigned char *s=(unsigned char *)str.data(), *se=s+str.length();
00198     while (s<se) {
00199         digit_t d=0;
00200         for (size_t i=0; i<bytesPerDigit && s<se; ++i)
00201             d |= (digit_t(*s++) << (i * bitsPerByte));
00202         *p++=d;
00203     }
00204     r._cleanup();
00205     return r;
00206 }
00207 
00224 std::string to_binary(const integer& n) {
00225     const size_t bytesPerDigit=sizeof(digit_t);
00226     const size_t bitsPerByte=std::numeric_limits<unsigned char>::digits;
00227     std::vector<unsigned char> temp;
00228     temp.reserve(n._get_length() * bytesPerDigit);
00229 
00230     const digit_t *p=n._get_digits(), *pe=p+n._get_length();
00231     while (p != pe) {
00232         digit_t d(*p++);
00233         for (size_t i=0; i<bytesPerDigit; ++i) {
00234             temp.push_back((unsigned char)(d));
00235             d >>= bitsPerByte;
00236         }
00237     }
00238     while (!temp.empty() && temp.back()==0) temp.pop_back();
00239     char *c=(char*)&temp[0];
00240     return std::string(c, c+temp.size());
00241 }
